You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
craft the item: light_blue_stained_glass_pane

assistant
output:

. The cursor is on the object: an empty slot. The Grounding action is <grounding> left_click (718,708)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
Open the crafting table and craft a birch trapdoor with birch planks.

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: birch_trapdoor. The 'show all' is deactivated. I need to choose the item in the recipe book. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Choose the item birch_trapdoor in recipe book</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(351,483)
. The object:  birch_trapdoor  is located at birch_trapdoor (352,483)
. The cursor is on the object:  birch_trapdoor . The Grounding action is <grounding> left_click (351,482)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
Craft the redstone torch with a stick and redstone dust.

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: redstone_torch. The 'show all' is deactivated. I need to choose the item in the recipe book. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Choose the item redstone_torch in recipe book</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(318,462)
. The object:  redstone_torch  is located at redstone_torch (309,468)
. The cursor is not on the object:  redstone_torch . The Grounding action is <grounding> move_to (309,470)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
Open the crafting grid and create a dark oak door with planks.

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: dark_oak_door. The recipe book is opened, I need to deactivate 'show all' to show available recipes. The Skill ACTION is <skill>deactivate 'show all'</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(387,381)
. The object: 'show all' is located at'show all'(438,329)
. The cursor is not on the object: 'show all'. The Grounding action is <grounding> move_to (437,329)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.
